author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Scientists at the University of Cambridge have engineered "hematoids," structures grown from human stem cells that produce blood stem cells in vitro. These self-organizing structures mimic the early stages of our body's development and could revolutionize the production of blood components for treating hematologic disorders. 

Source Article: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2211124725011441
